description.p: Diaprats of the order of the “grave knights” swear the oath to serve in their life and beyond the grave. They sacrifice their chance at the afterlife for an immortality of servitude for the greater good. In life a grave knight is expected to be a beacon of virtue, uncorruptible and worthy of wielding the great power and temptation that comes with undeath. Only few initiatiated become true undead or “catacomb saint” as to maintan the sense of self requires great amount willpower and dedication to the cause.
Through the teachings of the grave knights, the diaprats of the order share theese virtues:

Asceticism A grave knight must practice selflesness, complete absinence in material goods and worldly pleasures. Only through a rigid spiritual practice a grave knight may preserve the consciousness and sense of self into the undeath.
Self sacrifice A grave knight must not be afraid to give up its possessions, sustain wounds or be humiliated to protect those in need and fulfil its duties.

Chivalry A grave knight must hold itself to a high moral compass, be an example to the people and a pillar of the community. In undeadth a catacomb saint is not feared, but reveared for his deeds in life.

Mortality A grave knight walks a path of death and ponders mortality and frailty of existence. Grave knights will participate in frays, wars, disasters and epidemies close to the avant-garde where they can help the most and get accustomed with the concept of death.

description.p: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Dominate undead. As an action, you verbally command an udead creature to submit. A target undead creatue in 30 ft. that you can see must make a WIS saving throw or become charmed for the next minute. The charmed undead will obey your commands and fight on your side. If the creature has a CR of 1 or higher it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn.
Persistence of life. As an action, you channel your divine energy. All allies in 30 ft of you become stabilized and gain advantage to the next death saving throw.

At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, when you are targeted by a spell that would bring you back from the dead (such as raise dead or revivify), the spell requires no material components. Additionally you can choose to come back as an undead version of yourself known as “Catacomb saint”. This gives you the following benefits:
You gain an “undead” creature tag.
You no longer need breathe or consume sustenance.
You no longer need to sleep, instead to have a long rest you meditate for 8 hours reflecting on yourself. During this period you are aware of your surroundings.
You gain 120 ft. of darkvision.
You are resistant to poison and necrotic damage.
You are immune to poisoned and exhausted conditions.
You can choose to deal necrotic damage using your “divine smite” ability.
